name: 9-Way Tic tac Toe
note: combination of tic-tac-toe and domino pieces, some bent in a way that makes them only playable across board edges.

name: Adders and Ladders
note: Perfect information version of snakes and ladders, described in Winning Ways... by Berlekamp, Conway, & Guy

name: China Checkers
note: Like a 4x4 mills game, each player has three pieces.

name: Imuri
note: Had a larger (30x30) grid.  Removed from shelves for copyright infringement.

name: Nine Men's Morris
alias: Dean's New Game of the Mill

name: Quick Tic-Tac-Toe
note: unknown rules, board appears to be a (rect-grid 6 6) but without the center 2x2
